elements.name: intro_text
elements.html:
Welcome to Code.org's Exploring with Generative AI

Getting Started

Teacher Survey

Code.org relies on surveys as a crucial tool to remain connected to teachers, and to give you the opportunity to provide feedback about your experience teaching our curriculum.

The purpose of this survey is to understand better our teachers' experience with Code.org's Lesson 2: Research Process. 

Privacy and Confidentiality

  • Your individual responses here are completely confidential.
  • Your identity will never be revealed publicly or used to tie any responses back to you personally.
  • We may share de-identified, aggregate data (representing all responses) publicly.
  • Your de-identified responses will be used by Code.org to improve our curriculum and programs.

This survey should take less than 5 minutes to complete.  Your complete honesty and candor are appreciated.

elements.name: first_time_teaching_gen_ai
elements.title: Is this your first time teaching a Code.org Generative AI Unit?
elements.description: This getting started survey appears at the beginning of each Code.org Generative AI unit. If you are teaching multiple units, please only complete this survey once.

choices.text: Yes, this is the first Code.org Generative AI unit I am teaching
No, I have already taught other Code.org Generative AI units

elements.name: skip_survey
elements.html:
You can skip this survey

If have already taught a Code.org Generative AI unit and completed this survey, you can go back to teaching.

elements.name: teaching_background_header
elements.html:
Your Background

We'd like to get to know you. Please share with us a little bit about you and your background.

choices.text: Computer Science teacher
Classroom teacher
STEM / Technology teacher
Librarian / school media specialist
Other

choices.text: I have not taught Computer Science before
Less than one year

choices.text: Yes
No

elements.name: experience_teaching_ai_description
elements.title: Please briefly describe the AI content you've taught before and the context in which you taught it.

elements.name: module_expectations_header
elements.html:
Your Goals and Expectations

Please share with us what drives you to teach Generative AI and what barriers do you anticipate.

elements.name: module_goals
elements.title: What are your primary goals in teaching this unit?

choices.text: Enhance students' understanding of generative AI and large language models (LLMs).
Stimulate interest in AI and technology-related careers among students.
Develop students' critical thinking and problem-solving abilities through AI projects.
Integrate ethical considerations of technology use into students' learning.
Encourage creativity and innovation in the development of AI-driven applications.
Other.

elements.name: module_goals_other_comment
elements.title: Please describe what other goal do you have for this unit.

elements.name: module_challenges
elements.title: What challenges do you anticipate in teaching Exploring Generative AI?

choices.text: Lack of student interest or motivation.
Difficulty in developing my own understanding of complex AI concepts.
Difficulty of teaching complex AI concepts.
Time constraints within the academic calendar that limit how much content I can teach.
Integrating the unit with existing curriculum standards and requirements.
Managing diverse learning speeds and styles within the classroom.
Addressing ethical implications and societal impacts of AI effectively.
Other.

elements.name: module_challenges_other_comment
elements.title: Please describe what other challenges you anticipate for this unit.

elements.name: plans_curriculum_integration
elements.title: How do you plan to integrate the unit into your existing curriculum?

choices.text: As a standalone unit focused exclusively on generative AI
Integrated into a broader computer science or technology course.
Cross-curricular integration into a course for subjects other than computer science (ie: math, science, art).
Through extracurricular/out-of-school clubs or activities.
As a learning experience culminating in a showcase or competition.
By aligning the unit with other content  or projects to enhance interdisciplinary learning.
Other.

elements.name: plans_curriculum_integration_other
elements.title: Please describe in what other ways you plan to integrate this unit into your curriculum.

elements.name: thank_you
elements.html:
Thank You!

Thanks from Code.org for your time, thoughts, and passion for teaching.
